meanings.definition: The state or quality of being superior.
meanings.sent1: Her superiority in math made her the top student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The team's superiority in skills helped them win the championship.
meanings.sent3: His superiority in video games was evident as he defeated all his friends effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The company's superiority in customer service set them apart from their competitors.
meanings.sent5: The lion's roar echoed through the jungle, a sound that exuded superiority.

meanings.definition: The fact of being greater in quality, quantity, or degree.
meanings.sent1: The superiority of the cake's taste was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: The superiority of the new model's features impressed the customers.
meanings.sent3: The superiority of the storm's strength caused trees to sway wildly.
meanings.sent4: The superiority of the mountain's height made it visible from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The superiority of the sun's brightness lit up the entire sky.

meanings.definition: The feeling or belief that one is better than others.
meanings.sent1: His superiority complex often led to conflicts with his peers.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's superiority over his opponents was evident in every match.
meanings.sent3: The cat's superiority over the other pets was clear as it lounged on the highest shelf.
meanings.sent4: The politician's superiority in debates made him a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The queen's regal demeanor exuded an air of superiority in the royal court.
